title: This Day in Sports: Jim Harbaugh, Michigan blanks Michigan State on the road
text:
As the Michigan Wolverines football team prepares for an important conference battle against the Michigan State Spartans Saturday, it was this day 30 years ago today that Big Blue’s head coach throttled MSU on the road, 31-0.
30 Years Ago Today: QB Jim Harbaugh & Michigan beats Michigan State 31-0 on the road pic.twitter.com/4el26ThVoR
— Darren Rovell (@darrenrovell) October 12, 2015
Michigan head coach Jim Harbaugh was once a member of a Wolverines team that went 10-1 in 1985 to win the Fiesta Bowl over Nebraska.
For those who wonder why he’s been such a boost to the UM program, his background in the sport should have been an indictor for his success. Sure, Harbaugh is a fiery guy that has his own way of doing things, but those same personality traits are what made him a bowl-winning quarterback.
Just watch some of his highlights in the game:
